footer.text: Character Guide • Build: Kaedehara Kazuha | Update Date: 10/12/2023 | Editor: talpha

fields.name: Best Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Freedom-Sworn__
Kazuha’s signature weapon and one of his top choices especially for his personal damage. But in some scenarios/teams weapons like Xiphos' and Favonius can be better. Still, even for supporting capabilities, its a really good choice.

__Xiphos' Moonlight__
Kazuha's best 4 star weapon option when refinements are equal with Favonius Sword (keep in mind that its far more easy to get refinements on favonius sword). Gives significant amounts of ER through his EM to self and his team. It can even be better than Freedom Sworn in teams that dont benefit from the 16% Normal, Charged, and Plunge DMG bonus% Freedom Sworn gives.

__Favonius Sword__
Provides extreme comfort with an ER mainstat, as well as a passive that aids in further reducing his ER requirements, alongside his team’s. When using this weapon, crit rate substats are a high priority in order to proc the passive more consistently.

fields.name: Replacement Weapon(s):
fields.value:
__Iron Sting__
Considerable 4 star option because of its EM mainstat. Tho its passive is useless with full EM build, its still one of his top choices if players cant obtain the Freedom Sworn, Xiphos' Moonlight or a high refinement Favonius Sword.

__Dark Iron Sword__
Provides slightly less EM than Iron Sting but is still a very competitive option — especially for players who do not have the billets or want to save the billets to craft a different weapon, namely Amenoma Kageuchi, instead.

__Sacrificial Sword__
An ER stat stick which allows for chaining multiple skill uses in one window. However, using the additional skill cast runs into the same issue as his C1; taking more field time that otherwise could have been better utilised by the team’s On-Field DPS units.
Since Kazuha only deals one elemental skill damage instance, the weapon passive would be very unreliable to proc at lower refinements, with higher refinements aiding but still proc’ing the passive inconsistently.
